intro: Hieraciodes willemetiodes, commonly known as the Willemet's cinquefoil, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its basal rosette of serrated, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a cluster at the end of each stem. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in alpine or subalpine regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
